issue.title: GUI Plugins Fail to Load if Header File is in Sub-Directory

content.raw:
Hi, I don’t believe this problem is a matter of `include_directories`. I’ve already tried adding the `include/` directory to `include_directories`, and it doesn’t work. Furthermore, this problem only exists for GUIPlugins. When I add the header files for non-GUI plugins to `include/` there’s no issue even without changing `include_directories`.  
  
I know this problem isn’t very high-priority but I’m pretty sure it’s at least an actual bug.
content.html:
Hi, I don’t believe this problem is a matter of include_directories. I’ve already tried adding the include/ directory to include_directories, and it doesn’t work. Furthermore, this problem only exists for GUIPlugins. When I add the header files for non-GUI plugins to include/ there’s no issue even without changing include_directories.
